thread.title: Broncos take Ryan Ramczyk in Todd McShay's mock draft 2.0
thread.title_full: Broncos take Ryan Ramczyk in Todd McShay's mock draft 2.0

author: Zack Kelberman
title: Broncos take Ryan Ramczyk in Todd McShay's mock draft 2.0
text:
Broncos take Ryan Ramczyk in Todd McShay's mock draft 2.0 The ESPN draft guru has Denver addressing the offensive line at No. 20 overall. Slot to Denver Broncos Newsletter Newsletter 
Much has changed since ESPN draft guru Todd McShay released his first 2017 NFL mock draft . 
In his initial version, McShay had the Denver Broncos picking at No. 23 overall and choosing Florida defensive tackle Caleb Brantley . 
Now, with the draft order finalized and team needs becoming more clear, he's flipped the Broncos' selection (No. 20) to Wisconsin offensive tackle Ryan Ramczyk . 
What's next for the Denver Broncos? Donâ€™t miss out on any news, take a second to sign up for our FREE Broncos newsletter! 
McShay makes the case to take Ramczyk -- not Alabama's Cam Robinson or Utah's Garett Bolles . 
The first offensive lineman comes off the board at No. 20, which would be the lowest ever since the 1970 merger. This is a weak O-line class. Ramczyk, who's recovering from hip surgery, has the best tape of the group. He also has just one year of major college experience after transferring from UW-Stevens Point (Division III). Long and well-built, Ramczyk would serve as a much-needed upgrade for the Broncos up front. 
Ramczyk comes with medical baggage, as he underwent hip surgery in January, but would represent an immediate upgrade on Denver's lackluster offensive line. A first-team All-Big Ten selection in 2016, Ramczyk is billed by scouts as a strong yet athletic blocker. He's drawn comparisons to 49ers OT Joe Staley . 
The Broncos are expected to revamp their O-line this offseason, potentially chopping both starting tackles, Russell Okung and Donald Stephenson .
